text: Fabio Alperowitch is a Brazilian businessman, investor and is a co-founder of FAMA Investimentos, one of the leading independent asset management firms in Brazil, recognized for its focus on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) criteria in investment strategies. == Early Life and Education == Alperowitch was born in Brazil. He pursued higher education in Brazil and abroad, obtaining degrees and certifications that contributed to his expertise in the financial sector. == Career == Alperowitch began his career in finance in the 1990s, a period marked by significant economic changes in Brazil. In 1993, he co-founded FAMA Investimentos with the aim of creating an asset management firm that not only focused on financial returns but also on the social and environmental impacts of investments. This approach was relatively novel at the time, especially in Brazil, where the concept of ESG was still emerging. Under Alperowitchâ€™s leadership, FAMA Investimentos became a pioneer in the field of socially responsible investment in Brazil. The firm developed a reputation for its rigorous analysis of companies, evaluating not just financial performance but also corporate governance, environmental practices, and social responsibility. This approach attracted a clientele interested in ethical investing and positioned FAMA as a leader in sustainable finance. == References == Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:Brazilian businesspeople
